title: Warmup
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps: When a user is viewing the linescore for a game in Warmup
custom_expected:
Then there is no inning indicator
and no data under the inning number headers
and all 0's for RHE columns

title: Inning Indicator
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps: When a user is viewing the linescore for a game in progress

custom_steps_separated.content: when the game is in a Top inning
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the inning indicator is displayed on the appropriate top half of the inning

custom_steps_separated.content: when the game is in a Bottom inning
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the inning indicator is displayed on the appropriate bottom half of the inning

custom_steps_separated.content: when a game is in a Middle inning
custom_steps_separated.expected: then no inning indicator is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: when a game is in a End inning
custom_steps_separated.expected: then no inning indicator is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: when following a game
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the inning indicator updates accordingly to the rules above

title: Top of inning in progress (no runs)
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing a game in Top of the inning
and no runs scored
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the inning indicator
and no number is displayed

title: Top of inning in progress (runs)
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing a linescore for a game in progress
and inning has runs
custom_expected:
Then the user will see inning indicator
and the number of runs in the inning

title: Mid Inning
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing a linescore for a game in progress
and game is in mid inning

custom_steps_separated.content: and no runs scored in the top inning
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then no inning indicator displayed
and 0 in the top inning that just finished

custom_steps_separated.content: and runs scored in the top inning
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then no inning indicator displayed
and number of runs in the top inning that just finished

title: Bottom of inning in progress (no runs)
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing the linescore for a game in progress
and the game is in bottom of the inning
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the inning indicator on the bottom
and the user will not see a number

title: Bottom of inning in progress (runs)
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing a linescore for a game in progress
and inning has runs
custom_expected:
Then the user will see inning indicator
and the number of runs in the inning

title: End Inning
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing a linescore for a game in progress
and game is in end inning

custom_steps_separated.content: and no runs scored in the bottom inning
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then no inning indicator displayed
and 0 in the bottom inning that just finished

custom_steps_separated.content: and runs scored in the bottom inning
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then no inning indicator displayed
and number of runs in the bottom inning that just finished

title: Extra Innings
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing a linescore for a game in progress
and game is in extra innings
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the additional inning
and the linescore is scrollable to see all innings

title: Double digit runs (top and bottom inning)
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing a linescore for a game in progress
and both top and bottom have double digit runs
custom_expected: Then the runs are aligned evenly

title: Double digit runs (top or bottom inning)
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing a linescore for a game in progress
and either top or bottom have double digit runs
and other has either 0 or single digit runs
custom_expected: Then the single digit is aligned in between the double digit numbers

title: Final - Bottom of 9th necessary
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing a linescore for a game in final
and the home team batted in the ninth
custom_expected:
Then the user will not see X in the bottom 9th frame
and user will see the runs for that inning

title: Final - Bottom of 9th not necessary
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing a linescore for a game in final
and the home team did not bat in the ninth

**home team is leading after the top of 9th
custom_expected: Then the user will see X in the bottom 9th frame

title: Final - Extra innings
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing a linescore for a game in final
and game went into extra innings
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the additional inning
and the linescore is scrollable to see all innings

title: End early
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed
custom_steps: When a user is viewing a linescore for a game that finished early
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the runs for the played innings
and the X for the non played innings

title: Away Team Run
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing a linescore for a game in progress
and the user strings an away team run
custom_expected:
Then the run will update in both the inning it was scored
and the total runs (R column)

title: Away Team Hit
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing a linescore for a game in progress
and the user strings a hit for a away team
custom_expected: Then the hit column will update (H)

title: Away Team Error
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing a linescore for a game in progress
and the user strings an away team error
custom_expected: Then the error column will update (E)

title: Home Team Run
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing a linescore for a game in progress
and the user strings an home team run
custom_expected:
Then the run will update in both the inning it was scored
and the total runs (R column)

title: Home Team Hit
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing a linescore for a game in progress
and the user strings a hit for home team
custom_expected: Then the hit column will update (H)

title: Home Team Error
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
hen a user is viewing a linescore for a game in progress
and the user strings an home team error
custom_expected: Then the error column will update (E)

title: Double digit runs (total)
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed
custom_steps: When a user views a game with double digit runs

custom_steps_separated.content: and both teams have double digit runs
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the runs fit
and both are aligned

custom_steps_separated.content: and one team has double digit runs
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the runs fit
and sigle digit is aligned between double digit

title: Double digit hits (total)
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed
custom_steps: hen a user views a game with double digit hits

custom_steps_separated.content: and both teams have double digit hits
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the hits fit
and both are aligned

custom_steps_separated.content: and one team has double digit hits
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the hits fit
and sigle digit is aligned between double digit

title: Double digit errors (total)
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed
custom_steps: When a user views a game with double digit errors

custom_steps_separated.content: and both teams have double digit errors
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the errors fit
and both are aligned

custom_steps_separated.content: and one team has double digit errors
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the errors fit
and sigle digit is aligned between double digit
